intro: Rhexia nianga, commonly known as the pinkstem stellaria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded woodlands. It has slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. Rhexia nianga is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
